author: Audrey
text: 'Did not enjoy the food. It weirdly didn’t taste like Mexican food. Just got typical dishes - burrito
column5: quesadillas…The staff and ambiance was very nice though. The chips and salsa were good.'

author: Jessica Hinkle
text: 'The Mexican meal was amazing. Everything else was small portions and lacking flavor. Honestly
column5: never again'

author: Peter Cedeno
text: 'A hidden Gem in Hoboken. Food is genuinely Amazing in a very welcoming environment followed by a Staff that is on Point. Full disclosure
column5: i am not too much into Mexican cuisine But Bajas has coming back again and again. 😋🤗😋'

author: Tim Riggins
text: 'Without a doubt
column5: the worst restaurant I have ever been too. From the rude owner
column6: AWFUL service
column7: to their new increasing prices. If you go to Baja
column8: you’ll stand like an idiot inside the waiting for a table. Staff will walk past you
column9: like you don’t exist. Finally (after 10 minutes minimum) someone will say “oh
column10: do you want a table?” As if they’re surprised you’re there to eat. Once sat down
column11: let the timer begin! If you get a drink within 20 minutes
column12: congrats you’re the first I’ve ever heard of. Anything can be saved with good food and drinks right? Too bad you’re at Baja
column13: you won’t be getting either. Overpriced weak margaritas
column14: bad tacos and the greatest sin a Mexican restaurant can commit
column15: awful tortillas. I never review restaurants
column16: but the combination of bad food
column17: overpriced drinks and rude staff made me irate. Do NOT come here.'

author: OREN R
text:
'(Translated by Google) Excellent food and good service

(Original)
אוכל מעולה שרות טוב'

author: B Romo
text: 'Absolutely love this place. Always good
column5: always fresh
column6: and always a smile behind the bar.  A true taco heaven!!'

author: Valentina Largo
text: 'Service wasn’t that bad
column5: except that they took 45 minutes to bring the food. Other than that nothing good to say
column6: the food tasted terrible and the prices were pretty high. This was my first and last time there. This place is pretty bad.'

author: G Morales
text: 'Great food...great staff...always come out of here feeling like a butterfly lol'

author: Shawn McAdams
text: 'Love the enchiladas and flautas dishes with refried rice and beans.  They clili con queso is creamy and delicious.'

author: Horacio Kovacs
text: 'Chicken taco is a chicken wrap
column5: in the wrap you can find only chicken
column6: nothing else
column10: literally a chicken wrap in a tortilla (and the chicken is dry). Everything else very good'

author: Robert Modansky
text: 'Warm friendly atmosphere
column5: large portions'

author: richard newmark
text: 'Always goid food n a service'

author: Priyanka Bobra
text: 'Nice authentic Mexican food'

author: Dusan Pavlovic
text: 'Very decent food
column5: and the service was more than decent.'

author: momi sabag
text: 'We love Mexican food but we were very disappointed here. We ordered a few dishes
column5: none of them were good. The guac tasted stale
column6: the steak was burned. You have better chances at Chipotle...'

author: Rockie Rae
text: 'I got an appetizer a cheese quesadilla with the toppings. It was great and the portion was just right for a quick lunch.'

author: 360SiteVisit 6317427742
text:
'Came here for the first time and we loved it. Definitely will come back again.

The food was fresh and hot. Our server was sooo pleasant.  We asked for their hottest hot sauce and she was nice enough to bring a milder version.  That was the best because we could t handle the hottest 😊

We had two special margarita. A fajita a camarones and a chicken fajita.  The chicken fajita was a generous portion. Shrimp fajita was reasonable.
Love that it came with guacamole and beans

Very reasonably priced. Two drinks and two entrees tax and tips for two is under $80.'

author: Charlie Passmore
text: 'Below average food and service.'

author: Krysta Kalajian
text: "The food here is absolutely delicious! We have ordered a couple of times throughout covid but never actually came here before. We did outdoor seating and it was really nice. My boyfriend and I both ordered alcoholic drinks and I was shocked that we had to buy bottled water - no tap. They charged us for the water
column5: but I never received a bottle. For a dollar not a huge deal but kind of annoying as a whole.\n\nWe got a chorizo quesdilla as an app and 10/10 recommend! It was so freaking good. We didn't get little plates and chorizo is messy
column6: again not a huge deal just an inconvenience. I highly recommend their steak burrito
column7: the meat is actually really tastey and the burrito is huge! Overall would definitely recommend!"

author: Gloria Gibson-Washington
text: 'OMG!! Sooooo Good! I missed this place.  We moved out of the area and no one makes food like this place!!! So glad they made it thru the pandemic.'

author: Austin Bennett Green
text: 'Ok food. Busy and no excuse to have to wait over an hour for our meal to be served.'

author: Nick Veltri
text: 'Ordered my food an hour and a half ago and the guy had the audacity to call me and tell me that they were too busy to fulfill my order after I was waiting for my food for a while but has the time to call me and tell me they can’t make my order.'

author: Hakan Güneş
text: '- Guac tasted OK
column5:
although it said “medium spicy” in the menu - it wasn’t.
- Very long wait times for server
- They basically did not wipe our table even though we asked for it twice
- Both of our margaritas were close to non-alcoholic
column6: felt like they did not put any tequila in them.'

author: Betty A
text:
'(Translated by Google) Very good service.

(Original)
Muy buen servicio.'

author: Khushboo Lapsia
text: 'The food was very mediocre. It was empty on a Wednesday night but they asked us to sit away from the window as that was the only location they had for a “big party”.  The WiFi wasn’t working well so my boyfriend asked for a menu... AFTER the check came we were told the menu was old and the prices had increased. This is not the Baja I had remembered. Won’t be going back.'

author: Ryan Bednarski
text:
'Not very good
Margarita was ok
Forgot guac brought at end and still charged
quesadilla was soggy'

author: Marvin Hickman
text: 'Very cool experience. Went on a rather cold night and it was still comfortable in the igloo. Service in the igloo was excellent but the hostess initially seemed annoyed to have to go out in the cold. The menu is VERY limited so check it out prior to going as you will need to spend a minimum of $250 during the week. They do automatically add gratuity to the bill so take note of that. What we did eat was very good but was missing one thing...MARCUS WHERE WAS THE SALT?? You would have been chopped!!! The experience did offer a 5 star view and atmosphere. Overall would recommend for a definitely different dining experience.'

author: Ralf274
text: 'Food and drinks are great.'

author: Frank Guzman
text: 'Just have to go and see for yourself 😎'

author: Angelo Zepeda
text: 'Nice'

author: asa james
text: 'Great Food! Great Staff! Great Service!'

author: DJ Marly Mar
text: 'Delicious Food and Unique Drinks ...\nCheers !!! 😁💘🌮🌯🫔🍸'

author: Lisa Moriarty
text: 'The steak quesadia  food came to the table ice cold. The order was smaller than usual. The waitress had to be called 3 times so far. She did not pay attention. Tio many people to serve one table.'

author: Seda Arca
text: 'First time
column5: I went to this Mexican restaurant today in Hoboken. I cannot describe my satisfaction here. Everything was delicious!! Yes
column6: It’s still pandemic and there was almost no customers inside. We wanted to support local businesses in Hoboken. Most of the restaurants are closed on Monday in Hoboken. Baja is the one of the open places. We ordered Baja combo which is chicken
column11: sour cream and warm wrap (It’s for 2 ppl but enough for 3 ppl too). After we ordered our food
column12: they treated us with a nice nachos with salsa sauce. The waitress who is really nice and polite
column13: served our dinner 15-20 min later. (I am sorry that I didn’t ask your name). Food was Fantastic!!!!!  I’m a picky person. I only eat in certain places ( old fashioned woman) and I’m so happy to find out this place today!! I cannot wait to come back with my family and friends. Thanks for everything guys!!!\nPlease
column14: support local businesses due of pandemic. We need each other.\nThank you!'

author: maryfitzzz
text: "I have eaten here many times
column5: both inside and now outside the spot and it has always been a great experience. The food was great
column6: fresh and hot; just the way I like it. The drinks were terrific and the service was the best.  I will be back again and again. And the salsa and chips were the best I've ever had."

author: ashley
text: 'I cannot emphasize enough how great this place is! My bf and I went on a Monday night. It wasn’t busy. We were the second table in there. They first serve you with fresh cooked tortilla chips and salsa. The chips were still warm both times when we asked for seconds. We order house margaritas
column5: one mango and the other
column6: passion fruit. Both are also great. My boyfriend ordered steak fajitas and I ordered Baja steak tacos. We were both mind blown! The seasoning on the steaks are just TO DIE FOR! As much as we tried to continue savoring all that flavor
column7: we were already so stuffed!  As much as prices go
column8: I think it is worth it! I totally recommend trying it out!!'

author: Silvia Jaramillo
text: "Love this place & I can't wait to go back again. The waitresses
column5: waiters
column6: and bartenders are so courteous
column7: and the owner is very nice. The vibe is perfect
column8: especially now when all you want is a good night despite the difficult times we're going through. They are super professional
column9: very sweet with making you feel good
column10: and always looking to reassure that you get what you want and how you want it (like when I order the special margarita with more agave for my sweet tooth). Definitely coming again and would recommend!"

author: Sophia T
text: 'I highly recommend the steak tacos!'

author: Priyank Shah
text: 'Nice and testy food'

author: Jay Alvarez
text: 'HORRIBLE!!!!! NEVER AGAIN!!!\nWorst drinks
column5: no alcohol on them what so ever.\nFood took hour to get and didn’t even taste good at all. Sorry but this is the worst Mexican restaurant I been too. P'

author: Irais Rubio
text: 'Love this place the  Food it is Authentic Mexican!👏🏼'

author: Flabio Almonte
text: 'La cida riquísima is one of the best restaurants'

author: Liubov Kozynbaeva
text: "A very cozy
column5: down to earth place with a menu to die for. Caldo de Camarones is simply divine! A great selection of adapted
column6: yet authentic enough Mexican cuisine with perfect presentation
column7: various drinks and pleasant ambience. Waitstaff are attentive
column8: friendly and knowledgeable of their menu
column9: can easily recommend a best dish or drink for you if you're not sure. Hope to come back really soon!"

author: Joseph Tierney
text: 'Delicious !'

author: Sara Lin
text: 'Nice little spot in the far corner of Hoboken
column5: closer to the ferry. I always can go for their guac
column6: plus they have fun drink specials. I found that the veggie fajitas were a great option the last time I went since I wanted to go easy on my stomach
column7: but the typical chicken or steak dishes are really delicious as well. They also easily split the check three ways for us. Always a lovely time here!'

author: Owen Li
text: 'Just downstairs across the street. Portion large. Authentic.'

author: Mike Burke
text: 'Absolutely in love with the food here. Everything is cooked and seasoned very well
column5: plus portions of the entrees are quite large.\n\nStaff is alright
column6: they’re not on top of you the whole time but they could do with checking in a bit more. Drinks are a little pricey. Expect to pay like $20-30 for an entree and drink'

author: Amanda Shirley
text: 'The waiter had an earbud in the entire time making it impossible to get his attention. He brought part of meals
column5: and then went missing for over 15 minutes (not bringing the tortillas with a fajita order) to the point where I had to get up and find other staff. The food was also just okay
column6: but mostly disappointing. For example
column7: the guacamole was very pale and hardly verdant so there was definitely filler in it. The avocado crema sauce was actually slightly better guacamole but not a crema sauce at all. And the fish was chewy. They have a good drink deal though
column8: so maybe if you drink enough
column9: you would not mind the experience.'

text: 'Food was delicious
column5: drinks were great & the staff was amazing.'

text: "Hoboken's old school original Mexican restaurant. Great food with friendly service and a full bar!  Kid friendly too."

text: 'Great food hreat service'

author: J. Foy
text: "I love coming here. Its like a little gem!! First their margaritas are ALWAYS  on point. The quesadillas are soooo delicious!! I always get the chicken mixed with shrimp. Just a delightful little meal. My friends and I travel here from the bronx just to enjoy the chill vibes
column5: great food and drinks. The bartender is always super cool too. I don't know his name but i like his friendly service."

author: martin spector
text: 'The special is unbelievable'

author: Evan Stack
text: 'Really good sized portions at a good price. Always treat us well. Cheap margaritas during the week.'

author: Mawel Soler
text: 'Service was very quick and polite. Food was delicious as were the drinks. We had shrimp flautas & quesadilla

author: GR Alia
text: 'Love it'

author: kmason
text: 'I recommend Baja Mexican Cuisine. The atmosphere is friendly with a Mexican flare
column5: but the two main rooms are long and narrow.  The layout gave us a limited exposure to the entrance
column6: bar area and other diners
column8: and felt a little isolated. The food was excellent for that type venue but the prices are a bit high for what you get. For example
column9: a Kids Cheeseburger is $9.95. The service was very good and the location is highly accessible. So
column10: only a few dings for some pricing
column11: and seating configuration thats not the fault of ownership. Otherwise very good Mexican food and services!'

author: Ashley Bromiley
text: 'The only "authentic" style Mexican place that\'s ever made tacos I enjoyed and didn\'t make a huge fuss about not being able to swap out ingredients on their default tacos. The wait was a little long but it was 1000% worth it! Also this sauce was delicious:'

author: Tom Hennigan
text: 'The most authentic Mexican cuisine in the NY/NJ metro area!'

author: cali 1908
text: 'Just came was not greeted. Had a server peeking around the corner versus just coming and asking how you can assist. Sat with no place setting and no water with chips and salsa for my first 25 min of my dining experience. Service needs to be better if your price point is going to be what it is. This is not a Taco truck so please do not treat it as such.'

author: Caroline Miller
text: 'Very friendly staff. They didnt seem to mind my baby running around when no other customers were in. And gave us the best service. Great tasting food too! The Tortilla bowl is huge!'

text: 'We had food and drinks for 5 of us and payed around 180$. The food was not at all worth it.\nSoggy tacos
column5:
bad tasting enchiladas and horrible fajitas. We have had way better Mexican food. Its sad when spending money does not come off well.

Drinks were okay. Nothing Great!!

Never returning.'

author: Alex Ellick
text: 'A very understated Mexican Restaurant with outstanding food and attentive service. Ordered a frozen margarita and the chicken chimichanga and it was outstanding. The warm lighting and beautiful murals makes it a comfortable and pleasant spot to get dinner. Prices were medium-high but *totally* worthwhile. Wish I lived more local because I plan on coming here as often as possible.'

author: Zandra Lopez
text: 'Great tasting authentic Mexican food and large portion.  Great staff : friendly and attentive.  Loved the feel of the restaurant and owner is very hospitable.   Thanks again!!!'

text:
'This is our absolute favorite restaurant for the last 31 years. There is no Mexican cuisine NY or NJ that  even comes close. We have introduced no less than 40 families. it is THAT GOOD
7 STARS.
Order the HOUSE SPECIAL..its expensive but the platter for 2 easily.feeds 4. Which makes it a real bargin.
Go there ummediately...'

text: 'Excellent food and service.'

text: "I've been hitting this up town spot for over 20 yrs..mostly for the bar. I can go alone or with friends and always feel comfortable. Appys and drinks at the bar

text: "One of the few Mexican places in Hoboken which is not BYOB
column5: which can be good or bad depending on your mood. Margaritas are really good and so is the food. One of the reasons we go back to this place so often is the chips and salsa
column6: especially when the chips come out fresh from the fryer. Rest of the food is very good
column7: with very large portions. You will most likely taking some back home with you.\n\nHappy hour is very good as well
column8: but it's limited to the small bar area
column9: which can get crowded. They have a couple tables outside for dining outside."

author: Laura Rodriguez
text: "The food is always incredibly delicious. The chips and salsa are endless. The staff is always friendly. One of my favorite laid back places in Hoboken. And the food is sooooooo good. Did I say that already?\n\nI haven't had a dish I didn't love."

author: Christina Swoyer
text: 'My fiance and I went here for a quick lunch this weekend and wanted to sit outside. There was a wait so we decided to sit at the bar to order a drink and some guac to pass the time. Needless to say the margarita was subpar at best for the price and the guac never came. We were sitting there for a good 20min and nothing. We decided to cancel the order
column5: pay and leave. Also there is a minimum for credit cards which they failed to mention to us when we sat down so my fiance had to walk to the ATM to get cash to pay for drinks. For the expensive menu pricing and long waits we expected much more in service and quality.'

author: Kiara Ochoa
text: "Great place
column5: but the food could've been more Mexican."

author: Bresiamoa
text: 'Great food'

author: June Stoyer
text: 'I had a business trip and stumbled upon this quaint little family owned restaurant.. The food was excellent and the waitress
column5: who also made our cocktails provided excellent service even though the place was packed. The decor was very pretty
column6: too!\nThere was a little bit of a wait for our entrees but that is expected for a Saturday night. The manager was very nice and accommodating. I will patronize this restaurant again.'

author: Jessica Lucero
text: 'Great food and service'

text: 'The food is great

author: Amy Iandoli
text: "Horrible service and me and my friends food was cold and horrible. We waited a very long time for the food to come to our table and it was cold and soggy
column5: which means that it was sitting out for awhile. Pricing was outrageous and I don't know how this restaurant has 4 stars. Very disappointing."

column5: this is the best spot for Mexican food uptown. Always friendly staff and food isn't bad!"

author: Nikki Ghooprasert
text: 'Great food. Nice service. I love their Jumbo shrimp fajitas and nacho. Oh.. they make great sangria too. There was one in Jersey city but was closed down. Too bad. Now i have to go allllll the way to Hoboken for that. So from a weekly thing becomes a quarterly thing because of the crazy price of parking fee. Love the food.'

text: 'Texas girl likes this Mexican joint - that says mucho'

author: DJ Dprizzy
text: 'Yummy'

author: Lemuel
text: 'This is my place to go after work for a good margarita and a bite. Lovely atmosphere and great drinks. Bartenders are amazing. Try any of the quesadillas or guacamole.'

author: Andrew J. Coughlin
text: 'Delicious. Many GF options. Expensive.'

author: Sven Falkenburger
text: 'Strong recommendation for people visiting NYC. Location is close to the best view on whole Manhattan.\nDish is great mexican food
column5: especially have to mention the perfect beef. Complementary nachos up front
column6: nice service and a warm ambience completes the great experience.\nPlus the Margarita‘s and Tequila recommendstion from the barkeeper were perfect!'

author: Alex Harding
text: "Decent American Mexican food. Their chile con queso and salsa are good. The avocado margarita is pretty bland though. Entrees were overpriced

author: Laura Christie
text: "Came for dinner this evening for my birthday.  The place was quiet and not crowded.  The staff was so sweet.  The food and the drinks were super delicious and they gave me such a beautiful birthday banana with a sparkler.  Would totally recommend this place but I don't want people to know my new favorite place !!"

author: jas877 sp
text: 'I always go here and the food is always great and I usually get great waitresses. However this time we had a male server that we never seen before. We all wanted water and he kept pressuring the table to order drinks even though we said we were fine multiple times. Then made us feel forced to order more food and then leave more than 18% tip. Put 20% tip then our way out still questioned\nthe tip. Very disappointed.'

column5: great drinks and ambiance. Superb staff.'

author: Tanmoy Majumder
text: 'Their jalapeño on the rocks was awesome. We had to mix crushed pepper to their salsa to get it to be zingy. Loved the place and all the people their. Great experience.'

author: NR Construction
text: 'Better than East.LA as far as the menu goes'

author: prashanth r
text: 'When you enter it looks like  a bar
column5: but they also have seating inside and on the pavement. Great mexican cuisine..'

author: Edwin Martinez
text: "Incredible Food Can't Find No Where Else ! Very Pleasant atmosphere super satisfied . mango margarita at its best ."

author: daniel diaz
text: 'I got the texas burrito waoo it was excellent!'

author: Evelyn Cartagena
text: 'Love it. They are great and they service is always good.'

author: Austin Cawley-Edwards
text: "A+ happy hours and happy people. Burritos and enchiladas awesome
column5: outside of Latin just ok. Don't go with the ceviche
column6: do go with the Texas burrito."

author: Brian Luscombe
text: 'They make a fajita special for the table - loaded with grilled chicken
column5: steak
column6: onion
column8: and three different types of shrimp- stuffed
column10: and sauteed.  Then they serve it to the table with home-made tortillas. Their margaritas are amazing too!'

author: Jason Schlusser
text: 'Never ever order delivery on a weekend if you want to eat within two hours if at all.   Shame.'

author: Laverne Modeste
text: "The best Mexican food I've had and they the deliver to Jersey City!  The seafood burrito is very very good!"

author: Dave Weissman
text: 'Food is consistently good.  Space is a little tight
column5: so not a place to check out for a cozy night-out but definitely a staple for high-quality
column6: no frills mexican.'

author: Matthew Lambert
text: "Meh.... This is standard Mexican fare
column5: nothing to write home about. The grilled chicken inside the burrito seemed frozen reheated. North Jersey isn't really known for it's Mexican food. If you're in Hoboken looking for authentic Mexican then keep looking."

author: lauren deldotto
text: 'the food at baja is terrible - just overfried tortillas drenched in nasty
column5: oily cheese.  there is nothing unique
column6: special or even good here.  frozen margharitas are about the only reason to come.'

author: Willem Klein
text: "I ordered the steak chimichanga and it was the BEST mexican dish I have ever had - the steak was cooked perfectly and seasoned spectacularly: both the texture and flavor were phenomenal. The tortilla was fried and was light without being too crunchy - exactly how it should be. I went on a Tuesday night so I can't exactly speak to the service on a busier night
column5: but when I was there the waiter was prompt and our food came out quickly yet not rushed.\n\nThe table salsa and chips were also superb."

author: Bree K
text: 'I wanted to like this place
column5: but alas it was not to be. I was there with two other people early for dinner on a Saturday (5pm-ish). The waiter was strangely smug and purposefully not helpful when we were ordering drinks. The food was okay
column6: but when asked to combine two of our leftovers into one take-home container
column7: only one of the leftovers was actually saved. The best thing at this place was the black bean soup! Seriously
column11: and you are brought rice to put with it. I would come back here for the soup only. Otherwise

author: Ken Boyar
text: "BETTER THAN AVERAGE MEXICAN BUT IT DOESN'T MEAN THAT YOU CAN EXPECT ANYTHING UNUSUAL- A TACO AND BURRITO JOINT THAT'S ALL DRESSED UP."
